output_list.reason: The mintToken function has an integer overflow vulnerability in the mintedAmount addition, allowing the owner to mint an arbitrary large amount of tokens.
The transfer function has a wrong logic in the balanceOf checks, allowing a transfer to the zero address and not checking if the transfer amount is greater than the balance.
The transferFrom function has a wrong logic in the balanceOf and allowance checks, allowing a transfer if the balance or allowance is insufficient.
The transferFrom function does not check if the target address is a smart contract, allowing a contract to receive tokens without a fallback function.
The approve function does not check if the spender is a smart contract, allowing a contract to become an approved spender and receive tokens without a receiveApproval function.
